imdb.title: Saiki Kusuo no Psi Nan
imdb.plot: Saiki Kusuo is a powerful psychic who hates attracting attention, yet he is surrounded by colorful characters who always find a way to remove him from his everyday life.

episodes.title: The Disastrous Life of Saiki K. Final Arc
episodes.plot: Kuusuke challenges Kusuo, the Saiki brothers full-on take all their strength in the final battle set subtly by Kuusuke with the help of few friends.

episodes.title: The End Of Saiki Kusuo
episodes.plot: As the final days of their 2nd-year approaches. Kaidou and the gang plan to go on a trip but unfortunately, the world-threatening volcano erupts on the same day.

episodes.title: Restarting! Everyday Life, As Usual/Another Christmas Challenge/First Experiences of the Year are Important/Courtside Love Game/Dessert Buffet Disaster
episodes.plot: Kusuo's friends try to celebrate Christmas at Kusuo's house. Kusuo watches various television shows, which feature his friends and family in some way. Toritsuka joins tennis team. Kusuo transforms into a girl to attend a women-only buffet.

episodes.title: Firsthand Science Fiction 1/Sup! Love Challenge/Fashion Sense Out of Stock
episodes.plot: Kusuo unintentionally goes back to that time. Kusuo then attempts to right the timeline. Kuboyasu receives a love letter which turns out to be a trick. Kusuo goes shopping for clothes and ends up playing dress-up with Teruhashi.

episodes.title: Midwinter Disaster/The Saiko Conglomerate Home Visit/Come On Over to Saiko Land!/Invincible Disaster Prevention Measures/Congratulations on Your Graduation!
episodes.plot: The weather is freezing and Kusuo's classmates begin are forced to deal with a broken heater. Kusuo and his friends are made to visit Saiko's house.On a snow day, Kusuo is forced to play. Kusuo attends the senior graduation ceremony.

episodes.title: The Disastrous Life of Imu Rifuta/April Fools' Deceit!/Spring's Ultimate Weapon/Recycle! Trash Cleanup Competition/Cutting through the Silence, The Ghost in the Music Room
episodes.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

episodes.title: Rematch! Rifuta VS Teruhashi/Gifts of the Magi/The Lost Hamster with a Kansai Dialect/The Transient Miniature Animal/Massage Disaster
episodes.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

episodes.title: The Saiko Conglomerate's Luxurious Cruise/The Shipwreck of Saiki Kusuo 1-4
episodes.plot: Saiki and his friends are stranded on a desert island.

episodes.title: The Shipwreck of Saiki Kusuo 5-7/The PK Academy Press Club Guillotine/Farewell! The Last Day of Summer Break
episodes.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

episodes.title: Episode #2.8
episodes.plot: When a new psychic enters the school Saiki K. works hard to hide his powers; a time loop causes him even more trouble.

episodes.title: Episode #2.9
episodes.plot: Saiki K continues to try to hide his powers from the new psychic transfer student; the school overreacts when Teruhashi is absent

episodes.title: Episode #2.10
episodes.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

episodes.title: Episode #2.11
episodes.plot: Nendou gets a letter from a girl, Saiki gets to know a guy who is just average. In P.E Judo was practiced and Hairo was fired up.

episodes.title: Episode #2.12
episodes.plot: A hair cut is particularly flattering for nendo; Rifuta realizes she likes Teruhashi.

episodes.title: Episode #2.13
episodes.plot: Saiki k and friends seek a spot to enjoy the cherry blossom festival; Saiki k reveals why he is working to become more powerful

episodes.title: Episode #2.14
episodes.plot: Saiki K and the other psychic students form the psychic kids club; Saiki k struggles to draw Teruhashi

episodes.title: Episode #2.15
episodes.plot: Saiki K. helps the PK Academy baseball team when a cliche filled tournament

episodes.title: Episode #2.16
episodes.plot: The occult club investigates a creepy abandoned home; Saiki K becomes 100 yen man to raise money to buy a new coffee jelly maker

episodes.title: Episode #2.17
episodes.plot: Saiki K's brother Kusuke threatens to reveal his powers to the world; Kaido's friends meet his younger brother

episodes.title: Episode #2.18
episodes.plot: A classmate of Saiki K suspects his psychic powers; Saiko realizes he has true friends when he thinks about transferring

episodes.title: Episode #2.19
episodes.plot: Saiki K and his class put on a play for the school's culture festival

episodes.title: Episode #2.20
episodes.plot: Saiki K breaks his glasses having unexpected consequences; Saiki K and friends struggle to stay awake at a New Year's party

episodes.title: Episode #2.21
episodes.plot: Saiki K's grandparents get lost when visiting and wind up with unexpected escorts; Kaido and Yumehara have a misunderstanding on Valentine's day.

episodes.title: Episode #2.22
episodes.plot: Saiki K sends his clone on a mission to the market; Saiki K's classmate continues to try to prove Saiki has psychic powers

episodes.title: Episode #2.23
episodes.plot: Kusuo travels back in time to stop Touma from discovering his psychic abilities.

episodes.title: Episode #2.24
episodes.plot: In the season finale Saiki K is visited by every character who has appeared in the show since the beginning.

episodes.title: The Disastrous Life of a Psychic: Part 1
episodes.plot: Kusuo Saiki is a psychic with all sorts of supernatural powers. All he wants to do is to keep his head down and not draw attention to himself, but often things don't go as Kusuo hopes.

episodes.title: The Disastrous Life of a Psychic: Part 2
episodes.plot: Although Kusuo's parents are currently fighting each other, he tries to stay out of it since he thinks that it is a problem that they need to work out for themselves.

episodes.title: The Worst of the Worst?! Riki Nendou
episodes.plot: Kusuo's telepathic abilities allow him to read the thoughts of everyone around him. Everyone, that is, except for one particular individual.

episodes.title: Shun Kaidou, AKA The Jet-Black Wings
episodes.plot: Shun Kaidou is another one of Kusuo's classmates at PK Academy. He claims to have special powers and believes that there are dark forces at work that have evil plans for humanity.

episodes.title: Intelligent and Beautiful! Kokomi Teruhashi
episodes.plot: Kokomi Teruhashi is the quintessential pretty girl, leaving all the guys awestruck by her beauty and her sweet-as-honey personality. However, her attempt to bless Kusuo with her presence leads to some unexpected results.

episodes.title: Hot-Blooded! Dodgeball!: Part 1
episodes.plot: It's dodgeball time in Kusuo's PE class. As usual, Kusuo tries to conceal his abilities, but his attempts to keep a low profile lead to unexpected difficulties.

episodes.title: Hot-Blooded! Dodgeball!: Part 2
episodes.plot: Now that Kineshi is out of the game, Kusuo is the Paper Team's last hope to win. However, Kusuo is more concerned with figuring out how to keep his likability neutral so that he does not attract attention.

episodes.title: Reach Him! Sign of Love
episodes.plot: Yumehara Chiyo, one of Kusuo's classmates, has a crush on him. In order to get to know him better, she comes up with some plans to get closer to him.

episodes.title: Saiki Family Home Renovation?! Drastic Makeover!!
episodes.plot: Now that Kusuo's parents have reconciled, they want to sleep in the same bedroom. In order to do so, they need to move some furniture around and want Kusuo's help.

episodes.title: Deceive! Mind Control
episodes.plot: Have you ever wondered why none of the other students have called attention to Kusuo's unique looks? It all has to do with a little bit of mind control.

episodes.title: A Genius Magician?! Uryoku Chouno
episodes.plot: Saiki encounters a man performing a magic show in a park. Since he is a terrible magician, Saiki tries to get him to give up on pursuing this career. Also on the first day on school, Saiki and Kaidou follow Nendou to see why he's acting strange.

episodes.title: Second Encounter (on TV)! Uryoku Chouno
episodes.plot: Kusuo likes to watch TV because he can avoid reading the minds of the people on the TV, and thus is able to experience surprise and excitement like ordinary people. He experiences one such surprise when he sees Uryoku Chouno appear on TV.

episodes.title: How Shady! Dark Reunion!
episodes.plot: Shun is summoned by a mysterious individual who belongs to a group trying to destroy Dark Reunion. He says that they need Shun's help and tries to enlist Shun into the group.

episodes.title: Beachside Summer Story
episodes.plot: A new student, Aren Kuboyasu, has transferred to Saiki's class. Since he lived his entire life as a punk, he takes this opportunity to change himself and blend in with regular people. However, things don't go so smoothly for him.

episodes.title: A New School Term Starts! The Melancholy of Nendou
episodes.plot: On the first day of the new school term, Kusuo and Shun notice that Nendou is acting strange. Wanting to know what's up with him, they decide to follow him after school.

episodes.title: Please Make Me Your Apprentice!
episodes.plot: Saiki is approached by Toritsuka, another psychic who knows about Saiki's powers and who has the ability to see ghosts.

episodes.title: Psychic Medium in the Class Next Door
episodes.plot: Toritsuka enrolls in Saiki's school and uses his ghost-seeing ability to attract schoolgirls by telling them about their ghost guardians.

episodes.title: Kineshi Hairo, in Search of Lumber
episodes.plot: On the pretense of taking cooking lessons from Saiki's mother, Teruhashi visits Saiki's house only to find herself in a difficult situation. On a different occasion, Saiki's class holds a karaoke party in order to make good memories together.

episodes.title: Home Alone Disaster
episodes.plot: Saiki and his parents take a trip to the countryside to visit his mother's parents during his spring break. While his grandmother is very welcoming, his grandfather doesn't seem that happy to see them.

episodes.title: Crisis in Three-Month Relationship
episodes.plot: As usual, Toritsuka is trying to become popular with girls, and this time, it appears that he's succeeding. Saiki wonders why. On a different occasion, Saiki notices that he's being followed and lets himself get abducted.

episodes.title: Escape Using an Invincible Suit of Camouflage!
episodes.plot: The control device for Saiki's powers is broken. Without it, he can't control his powers. So the Saiki family decides to go to see the creator of the device, who currently lives in London.

episodes.title: Get Fired Up! PK Academy Sports Day: Part 1
episodes.plot: Summer break is around the corner. Saiki is looking forward to having some peace and quiet away from his classmates; however, as usual, his classmates have other plans. Will Saiki be able to avoid them all and have his peaceful break?

episodes.title: Get Fired Up! PK Academy Sports Day: Part 2
episodes.plot: The new school term has started and Saiki's homeroom teacher introduces a new student to the class. It turns out that he has an agenda at PK Academy. On a different occasion, Saiki's grandparents come and visit.

episodes.title: Get Fired Up! PK Academy Sports Day: Part 3
episodes.plot: The "amazing" magician Uryoku Chouno has become popular and sends Saiki an invitation to his solo magic show. On a different occasion, the usual gang is planning to hold a surprise birthday party for Saiki.

episodes.title: Don't Catch Fire! Safety Drill!
episodes.plot: Saiki's class rehearses a fire evacuation when they get stuck in a blocked-off hallway.

episodes.title: Enticing Premium Quality Coffee Jello
episodes.plot: Saiki ends up buying an expensive coffee jello, but sacrifices it in order to help a kid find his baseball.

episodes.title: In Order to Avoid Misfortune...
episodes.plot: Saiki observes Kaido getting conned by a fortune teller.

episodes.title: Teruhashi's Biggest Trial...
episodes.plot: Kokomi Teruhashi accompanies Saiki, Nendo, and Kaido to a suspicious-looking ramen restaurant.

episodes.title: The Disatrous Life of Psychic Medium Reita Toritsuka
episodes.plot: Reita converses with the local ghosts to search for a girl's missing gym clothes.

episodes.title: Stop the Killer Domino Effect!
episodes.plot: After having a foreboding dream, Saiki takes action to prevent a chain of events that will cause an explosion.

episodes.title: Reign of the Small King
episodes.plot: Saiki comes across an arrogant cat that is stuck between some walls, but refuses to help him until he sincerely says "please".

episodes.title: Frolic! Silent Night
episodes.plot: During a visit to Saiki's house for Christmas, Nendo reveals that he had never been visited by Santa, so Saiki's father dresses up as one.

episodes.title: Noisy New Year's: Part 1
episodes.plot: Saiki's parents become excited during the New Year's shrine visit when they have been praying for Saiki to make friends, and Kaido, Harai, Nendo, and Teruhashi show up.

episodes.title: Noisy New Year's: Part 2
episodes.plot: As everyone is invited over to the Saiki household, Kurumi accidentally blurts out that Saiki is a psychic.

episodes.title: Noisy New Year's: Part 3
episodes.plot: Saiki is forced to rewrite his classmates' memories of the previous day, but that action comes with its own downsides.

episodes.title: The Scariest! Mr. Matsuzaki
episodes.plot: Saiki stumbles upon some students planning to trick the strict PE teacher, Matsuzaki.

episodes.title: Chocolate Festival
episodes.plot: Saiki observes his classmates' reactions regarding receiving or not receiving Valentine's Day chocolate.

episodes.title: Absolutely the Worst!? Nendou's Father
episodes.plot: The ghost of Nendo's late father visits Saiki, who get annoyed and goes to Toritsuka to have him do something about it.

episodes.title: Totally Trusting! Kurumi Saiki
episodes.plot: Saiki's mother Kurumi doesn't doubt anyone, which makes her an easy target for pushy sales pitches. One day when Saiki gets home, he finds a mountain of products she has purchased.

episodes.title: Telepathy Silencer
episodes.plot: Saiki comes across a ring that blocks his telepathy, which he hopes to use to watch a movie without any spoilers, but he finds it a challenge and ends up sitting next to Teruhashi.

episodes.title: The Superstar Returns
episodes.plot: Kokomi's superstar brother Makoto shows up at Saiki's house to warn him to stay away from his sister, revealing that he has a disturbing sister complex.

episodes.title: Cast the Die! An Upset in the Finals
episodes.plot: While Saiki uses his telepathy to 'cheat' during exams in order to keep his ranking in the middle, but Nendo, who has been on the verge of failing and being held back, rolls a pencil and somehow does well.

episodes.title: Second Encounter (For Real This Time)! Uryoku Chouno: Part 1
episodes.plot: Chono recruits Saiki to be his assistant in a magic show so he can win his ex-wife back, who turns out to be Nendo's mother (and who like Nendo's deceased father bears a striking resemblance to her son).

episodes.title: Second Encounter (For Real This Time)! Uryoku Chouno: Part 2
episodes.plot: Chono's show takes a turn for the worse when Nendo offers to be his assistant in a body-cutting routine.

episodes.title: Mera's Money Situation
episodes.plot: Saiki helps out his poor classmate, Chisato Mera, who is secretly working various part-time jobs.

episodes.title: Reignited! Physical Fitness Test
episodes.plot: Saiki's class is having a physical fitness test during PE. Hairo seems to be even more fired up than usual now that he's found his greatest rival.

episodes.title: Little Love Story
episodes.plot: Realising that the cat from before, Amp, is likely in heat, Saiki transforms into a cat to try and help him confess to a female cat.

episodes.title: The Latest Crappy Game! Olfana's Story
episodes.plot: Since most mainstream video games are spoiled for him, Saiki ends up playing a shoddily-made RPG, becoming frustrated by all the hallmarks of a crappy game.

episodes.title: Welcome Home! Mama
episodes.plot: Saiki and Nendô are invited over to Kaidô's house.

episodes.title: The Best Way of Confessing Love?! Spirit-Summoning Technique
episodes.plot: After Saiki retrieves a boy's balloon, the boy starts thinking that Saiki is his favorite hero, Cyborg Cider-man No. 2. On a different occasion, Saiki teleports his father to his office and ends up staying to check out his company.

episodes.title: Jump! Cyborg Cider-man No. 2
episodes.plot: After Saiki retrieves a boy's balloon, the boy starts thinking that Saiki is his favorite hero, Cyborg Cider-man No. 2.

episodes.title: Industry-leading, Top-ranking Company?! Father's Job
episodes.plot: Saiki teleports his father to his office and ends up staying to check out his company.

episodes.title: Ciderman No. 2 Vs. The Lemonade Fiend
episodes.plot: Yuuta, who is now Saiki's neighbor, comes over to watch an episode of Cyborg Cider-man Version 2, but is surprised when Cider-man's nemesis pays a visit.

episodes.title: Kusuo Saiki's Holiday
episodes.plot: Saiki becomes livid when a pickpocket steals his wallet at a summer festival.

episodes.title: Kusuo Saiki's Woman Troubles
episodes.plot: Kokomi and Chiyo meet each other at a cafe, but when they start sharing details about their crushes, they realize they could both be competing for Saiki.

episodes.title: Who'll Win?! Fateful Grouping
episodes.plot: The students have to form groups for the upcoming school trip to Okinawa. Kokomi and Chiyo both want to join Saiki's group without having to ask directly, whereas all the other boys want Kokomi to join their group.

episodes.title: Trips and Disasters Go Together
episodes.plot: After Saiki manages to prevent Makoto from going on the school trip, a typhoon puts the entire trip in danger.

episodes.title: We're Here! Okinawa School Trip
episodes.plot: Saiki deals with all kinds of troubles during his class' flight to Okinawa.

episodes.title: Hello! Okinawa School Trip
episodes.plot: Saiki's class goes on a school trip to Okinawa. The rest of the class is excited to go on the trip, but for Saiki, it's just one problem after another.

episodes.title: I'm Sorry! Okinawa School Trip
episodes.plot: Saiki is woken by Toritsuka and realizes that the hotel and everybody inside has disappeared during his sleep.

episodes.title: The Worst Night-Time Incident in Okinawa
episodes.plot: After saving Kokomi who has one of his control devices, Kusuo ends up stuck with her as she believes she's in a lucid dream.

episodes.title: Yah! Okinawa School Trip
episodes.plot: When the class visits the beach, Chiyo gets annoyed that she gets hardly any reaction from the guys to her swimsuit.

episodes.title: See You Again! Okinawa School Trip
episodes.plot: Chiyo comes to admire Kaido after he protects her from some beach delinquents.

episodes.title: See You Again, Again! Okinawa School Trip
episodes.plot: Saiki attempts to get a limited Coffee Red Bean anmitsu before his school trip ends.

episodes.title: Sup Homies!! Outsider
episodes.plot: A transfer student named Aren Kuboyasu struggles to hide his past as a former delinquent.

episodes.title: A Transfer Student! The First Encounters
episodes.plot: Kuboyasu attempts to make friends with his classmates.

episodes.title: Mr. and Mrs. Nendou Together!
episodes.plot: Saiki reluctantly helps Nendo's father profess his love to his wife.

episodes.title: Guilty or Not Guilty?! Theft Case
episodes.plot: Inspired by a detective drama, Kaido looks into an alleged theft case at school.

episodes.title: Which Idea Will Be Picked?! School Festival Planning
episodes.plot: It's time for PK Academy's school festival. Hairo wants his class to make fifty thousand paper cranes as their attraction, but not even his enthusiasm is enough to get them on board for that.

episodes.title: Sing! Reita's Recital
episodes.plot: Reita ropes Saiki into helping out his band, whose members cannot play any instruments.

episodes.title: Go Wild! PK Academy School Festival: Part 1
episodes.plot: As the school festival gets underway, Saiki loses his glasses and accidentally turns Nendo into stone.

episodes.title: Go Wild! PK Academy School Festival: Part 2
episodes.plot: Saiki has to try and keep the petrified Nendo from being discovered or broken.

episodes.title: Let's Go to the School Festival Wrap-up Party
episodes.plot: Saiki, Kaido and Nendo get lost on their way to a wrap-up party.

episodes.title: The Perfect Pretty Girl vs. the Super Stubborn Guy: Part 1
episodes.plot: In order to avoid Makoto's drama shoot, Saiki ends up taking Kokomi on a date in the neighboring town.

episodes.title: The Perfect Pretty Girl vs. the Super Stubborn Guy: Part 2
episodes.plot: When Makoto changes locations to the neighboring town, Saiki tries to avoid running into him, while trying to use his extended time with Kokomi to get her to dislike him.

episodes.title: Psychic Santa Claus
episodes.plot: Saiki gets roped into acting as the neighborhood Santa Claus.

episodes.title: Let's Go Buy the Latest Electronics!
episodes.plot: Using his New Year's money from his parents, Saiki plans to buy a new television but gets pestered by the sales clerk.

episodes.title: New Year's Cycle
episodes.plot: Saiki's friends talk about their New Year's stories.

episodes.title: Kaidou's Suspicion: Part 1
episodes.plot: After Kaidô witnesses an incident between Kuboyasu and some delinquents, he becomes suspicious that Kuboyasu may be a delinquent.

episodes.title: Kaidou's Suspicion: Part 2
episodes.plot: Saiki and Kaido are confronted by more bullies and robbed when Kuboyasu drops by.

episodes.title: No Intervention Needed?! Nendou Vs. Kaidou
episodes.plot: Nendo and Kaido challenge each other to a game of air hockey; while Nendo has a natural knack to playing, Kaido employs cheat tactics to even the score.

episodes.title: The Worst Part-Timer
episodes.plot: Saiki, Kaidô and Kuboyasu find out that Nendô is working part time.

episodes.title: Fierce Run! Runners Psi!
episodes.plot: On a cold winter day, PK Academy is holding a marathon race. Hairo is keen to avenge his loss against Nendou in the sports test.

episodes.title: Teruhashi's Second Visit to the Saiki Residence
episodes.plot: On the pretense of taking cooking lessons from Saiki's mother, Teruhashi visits Saiki's house only to find herself in a difficult situation.

episodes.title: It's a Piece of Cake! The Straw Millionaire
episodes.plot: When Saiki lacks the funds to pay off a meal, he uses a technique called Straw Millionaire, which involves exchanging items with others of a similar but slightly increased value via teleportation.

episodes.title: Transformation! Super Size
episodes.plot: Stray cat Anp drops by the Saiki residence, and as usual, Saiki is not happy to see him.

episodes.title: He Should Repeat the Grade
episodes.plot: Kongo is a delinquent third-year student bully at PK Academy, but will be held back a grade unless he changes his ways.

episodes.title: Max Excitement! Karaoke Party
episodes.plot: Saiki's class holds a karaoke party.

episodes.title: Hurray! Tsundere Grandpa
episodes.plot: Saiki goes to his grandparents' house while on vacation with his family, and has to deal with his grandfather who has trouble showing his true emotions.

episodes.title: Hip, Hip, Hurray! Tsundere Grandpa
episodes.plot: Saiki's grandfather is still secretly happy about his daughter and grandson coming over to visit.

episodes.title: Welcome to the Farthest Amusement Park!
episodes.plot: Saiki and his family go to a run-down amusement park that is falling apart. After Saiki and his father ride a roller coaster, Saiki's grandfather gets jealous and rides with Saiki on the ferris wheel.

episodes.title: See you again! Saying Goodbye to the Grandparents
episodes.plot: On the day Saiki, Kurumi and Kuniharu are leaving, Kumagorou comes up with a plan to keep them around longer.

episodes.title: Congratulations on the Video Game Release! Kunio Saito's Horror Stories
episodes.plot: Saiki wants to play a video game called Kunio Saito's Horror Stories, but he has to make it home safely and without hearing spoilers. When he encounters his schoolmates or family members he gets a selection of video game choices to pick.

episodes.title: Take Advantage of the Talent! Toritsuka's Plan to Get Popular
episodes.plot: Toritsuka has become popular with the girls by letting ghosts possess him and show off their many talents, but things go wrong when the ghosts want to possess him during his big date with the group of girls.

episodes.title: Use Your Smarts! The PK Occult Club
episodes.plot: As usual, Toritsuka is trying to become popular with girls, and this time, it appears that he's succeeding. Saiki wonders why. On a different occasion, Saiki notices that he's being followed and lets himself get abducted.

episodes.title: The Worst Cooks
episodes.plot: Saiki's class has to make crepes, but Saiki discovers his partners Kaido and Hairo have no cooking abilities.

episodes.title: Court is in Session! Kokomins Trial!
episodes.plot: Saiki is abducted by members of the Teruhashi Fan Club, who are bothered that Saiki has been spending way too much time with Kokomi.

episodes.title: Horror! The Disastrous ___th Episode of the Anime
episodes.plot: While walking with Kaido and Nendo, Saiki notices that everyone seems to be talking about things that are connected to the number 100, but he cannot quite figure out why.

episodes.title: Here Comes the Mad Scientist!: Part 1
episodes.plot: The control device for Saiki's powers is broken. The Saiki family decides to go to see the creator of the device, who currently lives in London.

episodes.title: Here Comes the Mad Scientist!: Part 2
episodes.plot: The Saiki family goes to London to get the control device fixed by Kusuke, but get sidetracked by Kusuo's parents sightseeing. Kusuo explains why the brothers dislike each other.

episodes.title: Here Comes the Mad Scientist!: Part 3
episodes.plot: Kusuke shares his back story about how he's never beaten his little brother at anything, so he comes up with a challenge to beat him.

episodes.title: Run for It! A Battle of Wits
episodes.plot: Saiki, Nendo, and Kaido play a game of tag in London in which Kusuo must evade Kusuke for three hours.

episodes.title: Please at Least Be Quiet in the Art Museum
episodes.plot: Saiki, Nendo, and Kaido go to an art museum in London. Kaido tries to overanalyze the modern art pieces when Nendo makes his own drawing, which gets the approval of the curator.

episodes.title: Disaster Before Summer Break: Summer Break! The Occult Club Training Camp
episodes.plot: With summer break coming, Saiki tries to decline participating in the plans brought up by his schoolmates.

episodes.title: Summer Break! The Tennis Club Training Camp
episodes.plot: The Occult Club holds a test of courage in a forest, but the random pairings are not what the members expect. After that, Saiki's off to the Tennis Club's training camp.

episodes.title: Summer Break! Clinical Testing Job
episodes.plot: Nendo teams up with Saiki in a tennis match against Hairo. Then Saiki and Nendo join Mera in a clinical testing job but the medicines have weird side effects for Mera and Nendo.

episodes.title: Summer Break! A Date with Teruhashi
episodes.plot: On the last day of summer break, Saiki goes on a date with Teruhashi at the amusement park. However, Saiki brings Yuuta along, who wants to see a hero show in which the villain "abducts" Teruhashi.

episodes.title: The Heir to a Conglomerate Makes His Appearance
episodes.plot: The new school term has started and Saiki's homeroom teacher introduces a new student to the class. It turns out that he has an agenda at PK Academy. On a different occasion, Saiki's grandparents come and visit.

episodes.title: Break through the Overwhelming Financial Power!
episodes.plot: When Kokomi turns down Saiko's love confession, Saiko starts making life difficult for Kokomi and Saiki's family and friends.

episodes.title: Tsundere Grandpa Returns!
episodes.plot: Saiki's grandparents come and visit Saiki's family. When they all go out, Saiki's grandfather's mean behavior towards his father leads him to be left alone in a strange place when he meets Nendo.

episodes.title: Holding a Halloween Party
episodes.plot: Kaido invites his friends to a Halloween party at his place, but the guys have no clue as to its associated traditions.

episodes.title: The Saiko Family's Unbeatable Financial Power
episodes.plot: In order to gain control his classmates, Saiko takes Nendo out to a fancy restaurant and then offers to pay Nendo a large sum of money to be his underling.

episodes.title: Talent Blossoms?! Melancholy of a Popular Magician
episodes.plot: Chôno Uryoku has become popular and sends Saiki an invitation to his new show.

episodes.title: An Exercise in Runaway Delusion
episodes.plot: Chiyo has gained an enormous amount of weight, so Saiki tries to help by implanting Kaido's voice to motivate her.

episodes.title: Break-time Disaster
episodes.plot: The usual gang is planning to hold a surprise birthday party for Saiki.

episodes.title: Crushed! Surprise Party: Part 1
episodes.plot: Saiki watches as his friends plan a surprise birthday party, but the date is actually his father's birthday. They discuss the gifts they will give him.

episodes.title: Crushed! Surprise Party: Part 2
episodes.plot: Kusuo tells his father to continue to pretend to be him so that his friends don't feel bad about having celebrating a birthday party on the wrong birthday.
